intro: Armeria cariensis var. rumelica, commonly known as the Sierra Valley sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and inland grasslands. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a compact growth habit, making it well adapted to its arid or semi-arid environment.
